intro: Maba motleyi, commonly known as the Motley's maba, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with distinctive sap and colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas.
